WorkItem.Description:
When evaluating unary operators the second argument in the context should be set to null.

I declared a call dispatcher for a unary operator "not" just for booleans and I kept getting that it was not defined for System.String because there was a reminder string in the second argument from the context from the previous evaluation.

Comments.Message: Will look into this. thanks for catching and reporting. Will fix it when I come to reimplementing runtime in latest source version.
